page.title: 02LIFESTYLE IN NANTGLYN.
page.content: The villagers were happy with life in Nantglyn, except that they wanted a village shop and a better bus service. The only village facility is the sub post office.Most of the older residents spoke Welsh as their first language and a popular pastime was watching Aled Jones the soprano on S4C The oldest man in the village(71) was born in Nantglyn. At that time the roads had no hard surfaces,but the village was much busier with the forge open and a thriving store. The house he now occupied had been an inn but it was bought and closed by the chapel in the 1920s.He had run the Post Office and agricultural stores. It took two people all morning to deliver the mail.The village is much quieter today but he prefers it that way.
